title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION, CHILD POVERTY

description.narrative: Improved effectiveness of social protection programmes and social services to respond to multidimensional poverty and needs of children and their families in difficult life situations., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, especially the most vulnerable, are protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and abject poverty and increasingly utilize quality, integrated social protection services, and parents and caregivers change their attitudes and behaviours on violence against children.

participating-org.narrative: SPC FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL REHABILITATION

sector.narrative: Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Policy and strategy development and coordination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Strengthening the social welfare workforce and direct outreach to families
Technical assistance - Child poverty, Public Finance and Local Governance

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved effectiveness of social protection programmes and social services to respond to multidimensional poverty and needs ofchildren and their families in difficult life situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the Government to improve social protection programmes through the annual Kazakhstan Social Workers Forum, evidence generation via evaluation of the social protection system, drafting new social protection laws, implementing child-focused public finance management policies, and capacity building of frontline social workers in basic competencies for engagement at individual and community levels. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
